pageContext.claim: “Yet in recent years, the United Nations has not reached its full potential because of bureaucracy and mismanagement. While the United Nations on a regular budget has increased by 140 percent, and its staff has more than doubled since 2000, we are not seeing the results in line with this investment.”
pageContext.analysis: The United Nations bureaucracy is the secretariat, which has shrunk every year since 2010, BBC Reality Check found. There are different budgets and different time periods for budgeting within the UN, so it's unclear exactly what he's talking about regarding the 140 percent increase. If he were referring to the "regular budget" of the UN he'd be almost righton the numbers, but it's not the whole story because it does not include the cost of peacekeeping operations, BBC Reality Check found.
